posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Following on from my previous request (which I'll now start constructing), my second character is possibly harder to define.

In an ideal world, she'd be a really big Dwarf, mostly DwD and CoT, but this ain't one, so I'm thinking probably Half-Orc (never played one of those before). Much more a "bring it to me" character. Warhammer and shield, heavy armour, high STR and CON - a veritable immovable object and imposing presence, but a great tactician. Slow to rile, but once roused...Probably ought to be LG, but unfortunately that would knacker Barbarian. My best guess would be a few levels of Barbarian and Fighter, and loads of CoT, but it just doesn't seem quite right. Too...simplistic, perhaps, particularly given that she's supposed to have an indomitable will - and boosting Half-Orc INT may be a thankless task.

Any thoughts? (Other than "go away")

Cheers

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
What do you think of Max's two half-orcs based on campaign henchies?

Daelen Red Tiger: a DW terrifying taunter that could be modified to hammer/shield
or
Xanos Messarmos: a spellsword (or in your case, spellhammer) quite capable at both ends of the spectrum

Both are semi-intelligent fullplate builds.  Am betting he played both these through on WoG so you should be safe testing them out yourself.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thanks Hip. My bad, I missed the Daelan build in Hip's Fabulous Contrapulator. That seems pretty much what I was looking for. As with my previous request, this is DW build, so that gives me some scope re feats - and I can drop some DEX (don't need Ambi) for more CON, and given that she'll be "full plate and packing steel" rather than wearing wire wool, that shouldn't impact hugely on AC. Oh, assuming a 15 DEX isn't a HS requirement (never played that before either).

Anyway...Good stuff! I now have templates for both my hopefuls.

Cheers

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Why did you decide you didn't want her to be a Dwarf? You say you want high STR and CON, but also a good INT. Both Half-Orc and Dwarf boosts one of those first two, but the Dwarf does hot have a penalty on INT.

You want to run both at the same time? Are you planning coop with a friend?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Simply trying to recreate my written characters as closely as possible, and, annoyingly, in my writings she's 7ft tall. However, your question makes me doubt the validity of putting appearance over characteristics, and her traits are pretty Dwarven...

Bugger.

So, now I'm thinking DwD/CoT/Fighter or Rogue, with the emphasis on the first two. I'll do a search.

As to your other questions: yes. I suppose that means finally heading into a PW, but my friend (who's read everything wot I've wrote, and these two do spend a lot of time in each other's company) has just got Baldur's Enhanced, so I might give them separate run-throughs in Aielund first, just to see how they perform (I'm guessing this particular character will be mine)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Have done searchy thing, and I think a couple of tweaks on Valerfor's second iteration of his Full Metal Soldier trumps the Daelan build for my purposes - contained within the link http://nwnecbuild.forumer.com/topic/2354337/

Thanks again

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Aielund is awesome, but you should play something else once in a while.
Have you played SoU, the Nether Scrolls, HotU, and Sands of Fate yet?
Or Saleron's Gambit?
Or the Adam Miller campaign?
Or The Eye of the Beholder (I recommend the first one because I never was able to complete the second one, presumably because of a bug)?
Or The OC + Aribeth's Redemption?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
You're absolutely right, Empyre, and I will. I tend to be a bit obsessive with each campaign, trying to master it in several incarnations, before going on to the next. Thus, my first year was spent exclusively on the OC + Aribeth's Redemption and SoU + HotU, then this last six months has been Aielund-centric. That would seem to indicate that I'm about due a shift in focus. I have Sands of Fate loaded already, so it'll probably be that next. I've been recommended the Adam Miller campaign almost since joining here, but I can't remember the names of the mods for it and the Vault doesn't seem to recognise a search for 'Adam Miller', so perhaps you could remind me, please?

Cheers

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Here you go:
http://neverwintervault.org/project/nwn ... -campaigns

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
If you play the same campaign over and over, you risk getting tired of that campaign or even tired of NWN itself. To avoid that, I alternate between different campaigns with different builds. Here is what I played in the last few years:

DEX-based Elf Rogue 16 / Wizard 2 / AA 22 with longbow in SoU ... Sands of Fate
STR-based Bard 11 / Fighter 14 / RDD 15 with scimitar in the OC + Aribeth's Redemption
STR-based Bard 11 / Fighter 14 / RDD15 with longsword in The Eye of the Beholder
DEX-based Rogue 19 / Monk 11 / Fighter 10 with kamas in SoU ... SoF
STR-based Cleric 4 / Fighter 14 / WM 22 with katana in Aielund
STR-based Fighter 18 / Bard 7 / RDD 15 with longsword in SoU ... SoF
STR-based Monk 32 / Fighter 8 unarmed in Aielund
DEX-based Rogue 19 / Monk 11 / Fighter 10 with kamas in the OC + AR
STR-based Rogue 7 Fighter 8 / WM 25 with longsword in SoU ... SoF
STR-based Rogue 26 / Fighter 4 / CoT 10 with longsword in the Adam Miller Campaign
STR-based Fighter 18 / Bard 12 / RDD 10 with katana in Aielund
STR-based pure Cleric with morning star in Saleron's Gambit
STR-based Monk 25 / Sorcerer 1 / RDD 14 unarmed in Aielund
STR-based Rogue 26 / Fighter 4 / CoT 10 with longsword in Eye of the Beholder
STR-based Fighter 24 / Bard 9 / WM 7 with scimitar in OC + AR
and currently,
STR-based Dwarf Fighter / Bard 6 / RDD 10 with longsword in SoU ... SoF

There are some other builds I played before that, but I don't remember exactly what and in what order. Here is what I have planned for the future:

DEX-based Elf Rogue 17 / Wizard 1 / AA 22 with longbow in Aielund
STR-based Fighter 8 / Bard 4 / RDD 8 with longsword in Adam Miller campaign
STR-based Rogue 26 / Fighter 4 / CoT 10 probably longsword in Saleron's Gambit
STR-based Druid 28 / Fighter 4 / CoT 8 with scimitar in OC + AR
DEX-based Monk 25 / Fighter 10 / Shadowdancer 5 in Aielund (I'll need to update my ancient Aielund for this)
DEX-based Halfling Rogue 25 / Fighter 4 / CoT 11 with daggers in SoU ... SoF
STR-based Monk 25 / Sorcerer 1 / RDD 14 with kamas in Eye of the Beholder
STR-based Cleric 17 / Fighter 3 with longsword in Adam Miller campaign
STR-based Rogue 26 / Fighter 4 / CoT 10 with katana in Aielund
DEX-based Elf Rogue 17 / Wizard 1 / AA 22 in OC + AR
STR-based Monk 25 Sorcerer 1 / RDD 14 with kamas in SoU ... SoF (repeat from long ago)
STR-based Fighter 8 / Bard 4 / RDD 8 with scimitar in Saleron's Gambit
STR-based Fighter 20 / Bard 10 / RDD 10 with shortwords in Aielund

I would be happy to share any of these builds.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thanks for the Adam Miller link, Empyre, greatly appreciated. IIRC, it's a low-med magic campaign, which should test transferable builds more strongly than mid-high magic environs - and that has to be a good thing.

I'll be putting your campaigns history into my 'favourites', so I'll always know where to find it and ask for details. I suspect our prefered styles synch, in that we seem to prefer a more mundane (as opposed to arcane) approach. That said, you have much more discipline (as well as ability) in your focus than I. I tend towards a butterfly approach - whatever build grabs my fancy at a time - sometimes several at once. Sad but true.

So, first in line is your persuasive archer (see, I remember!). Please do let us know how that goes - I'm guessing in the Aielund thread.

To get back on topic (and demonstrating the butterfly nature in action): I think maybe I was seduced by going Dwarf because I'm familiar with that type of build and race. So I've decided on Half Orc to test myself. I'm torn between a variation on Valerfor's Savage Strike (F12/Rog2/CoT26) and Max's aforementioned Daelan build.

Great fun, Boo! (yes, I'm still quoting Minsc)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Promise this will be my last off-topic contribution (even though it's my thread) - if there are more I'll have to create a thread in Modules.

I've just checked out the Adam Miller campaign downloads (linked by Empyre, above, to whom thanks). If you'll recall, I'm technologically crap, so please bear with me. Do I need all three - the .EXE, .7z, and .ZIP formats, or can I just use the one? I've used all of them in different situations previously, but am a tad unclear what to do this time.

Sorry for being a thicko.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content: That just 3 different compression versions of the same content accessible depending on which decompression app you have installed (7z is typically the smallest compression as it is here).  A lot of authors do this.  Some offer WinRAR versions as well. Choose one of those listed and follow the directions on the project comments by Carcerian and you are good to go.  IMO I'd stay clear of any exe's if there is a choice because those usually run an installer.  I prefer to know exactly what I added and where located just in case a problem crops up I can easily reset the status quo myself.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thanks Hip, I'll give the 7z a go. Oh, and I already wrote Carcerian's installation instructions down - knowing my proclivity for buggering things up (technical term)!

I'm surprised the campaign doesn't have an entry on the Modules forum. If it becomes as addictive as Aielund, I may have to start one.

Cheers

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
All appears to have gone well (surprisingly)! I'm assuming the mods are played in Shadowlords, Dreamcatcher, Demon order, although Carcerian does say that loading Demon0 gives you a few goodies before starting, while Demon1 begins immediately. Thus, should I start from Demon0 or Shadowlords? I'm now confused, sorry (can't find an emoticon for that).

Cheers

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Demon is the final part of the series. Demon0 is only for players who want to skip the first 2 parts.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Top man, Empyre. Thanks. It'll probably be a couple of weeks before I begin, but very helpful to know.

Cheers

posts.content:

Thanks
